newsitem.title: UK: Oxford Mole to buy 2 U.S. firms, sets rights.
newsitem.headline: Oxford Mole to buy 2 U.S. firms, sets rights.

text.p: Britain's Oxford Molecular Group Plc said on Thursday it was planning to acquire two U.S. software businesses, Genetics Computer Group and the software business of MLR Automation, for an initial combined consideration of 13.9 million stg.
Oxford said the acquisitions would be financed through a one-for-seven rights issue at 360p per share to raise 30.4 million stg net of expenses.
There would be a further contingent consideration of up to a maximum of 900,000 stg in cash.
Oxford Molecular said it had also signed a collaboration agreement with Astra Arcus AB, a subsidiary of Sweden's Astra AB.
According to the agreement, both firms will jointly develop desktop software for research scientists.
During the one-year project, both firms will develop software tools which will help to define, store and analyse data at every stage of drug research.
Once the project is complete, Oxford Molecular will retain intellectual property rights to the new software and will be able to market the product freely to other pharmaceutical companies.
Oxford Molecular did not reveal any financial details.
